content.description: A cluster of warmup boulder problems about 100 yards past the chingato boulder
content.location: Many routes that are all in the v-easy to v3 range

content.description: For this hard slab start far left on a small divot and move up and right using the easiest possible combination of holds.
content.location: Right to the left of chingato arete

content.description: Awesome highball arete.  The crux comes about halfway up and the fall from there is safe.  Great holds to top out but would not want to fall.
content.location: From the other boulders head uphill towards a cliff band.  Look for the obvious tall and overhanging arete.

content.description: Start far left on the jug.  Set up and dyno to the right side of the face.  Heel hook and bear hug your way up.

Obvious face on good dacite to the right and above Radical Dales. Start low and move up left on great holds onto the arete. Set up for the crux and throw to a bad pinch, move off the pinch to a jug rail and don't fall topping out.
content.protection: lots of pads and a good spotter

content.description: Chingato arete goes up the obvious arete.  Either sit start for V5 or stand start for V4
content.location: About half mile in on the trail before you get to the main boulders you'll see this right of the trail to your right.  It has a small trail going around it.  The side you see has a fun warmup rail and an easy crack.  Walk around to the back and the lines are obvious.

content.description: This area is to the east of the old bouldering area the bird sanctuary.  Super sunny and warm area great for late fall and winter climbing.  This area was probably climbed many years ago and forgotten about.  If so just let me know and I can change names and FA credits.  Last winter we did around 40 problems here ranging from super easy to a handful of V7 and harder.  The area has a lot of lowballs, but some super proud highball sends. I'll update with more problems as I get the time.
